docs.snippet: Striker Nicolas Anelka was thrown off France's World Cup squad Saturday after reportedly insulting Coach Raymond Domenech. Noel Le Graet, the French Football Federation vice president, told France's RTL radio that the decision was made after Anelka...
docs.lead_paragraph: Striker Nicolas Anelka was thrown off France's World Cup squad Saturday after reportedly insulting Coach Raymond Domenech. Noel Le Graet, the French Football Federation vice president, told France's RTL radio that the decision was made after Anelka refused to apologize. Anelka, who plays for Chelsea, exchanged strong words with Domenech at halftime during a 2-0 loss to Mexico on Thursday.
docs.abstract: Goal column; French soccer striker Nicolas Anelka is thrown off France's World Cup squad after reportedly insulting Coach Raymond Domenech during 2-0 loss to Mexico (M)

docs.snippet: Both teams have struggled in the World Cup and endured turmoil off the field in South Africa.
docs.lead_paragraph: JOHANNESBURG -- Franck Ribery is leading an unofficial investigation to find out who spilled to the news media the details of Nicolas Anelka's outburst at France Coach Raymond Domenech.

docs.snippet: Dissent, chaos and self-destruction among two former soccer powers.
docs.lead_paragraph: The amateur pantomime that is England's 2010 World Cup campaign took another theatrical turn on Monday, perhaps more entertaining in its way than the mercy flight of WAGs winging its way to South Africa in defiance of Coach Fabio Capello's ban on wives and girlfriends.
